subNodes.conversationText: root
Greetings, friend.  I am Gossam Thistefall, follower of Sheela Peryroyl and adventurer.  Who might you be?
I am <FullName>, <class> and adventurer.  I am honored to meet you.|***ga_global_int-->String::courteous    String::++    |
Likewise!
An adventurer, are you?  Well, <FirstName>, I have a proposal for you.  You are an adventurer, and so am I.  I came to this region from Corm Orp, to the south, for two reasons.  Would you hear them?
Tell on.
Whether I would or not, I am sure that I will.|***ga_global_int-->String::ironic String::++ ***ga_global_int-->String::abrasive String::++ |
I see you are a fine judge of character.
The first is simply that I wished to see the world, to walk among strange trees, and to do whatever good I am capable of doing.
The second is that, besides being an adventurer and priest, I am a student of the natural world, and particularly of botany.  This region has a number of rare flora that I would like to investigate.
My nephew comes by collecting quite naturally, though I personally do not understand why anyone would prefer picking posies to collecting books and antiquities.
Well, Uncle Oudin, a flower can be as much a book as any of these things scattered across your floor.  For those who are literate in the ways of flowers, of course.

We are of the same mind, my friend.  As a <class>, I, too, delight in the wild.||***ga_global_int-->String::gossam_inf    String::++    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::3    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::7    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::13    ||
I am glad to hear you say so! |***ga_global_int-->String::gossam_inf    String::++    |

In any case, I am looking for a group of adventurers to join.  I offer you my skill in healing, knowledge of the natural world, and--if this does not sound too vain--my level head.  Not to mention my sling.
It warms my heart to know that my serious-minded young nephew is still the boy famous for squirrel-slaying in Gullykin.
Indeed--though I have slain a few things more dangeous than squirrels since then.  Will you have me, <FirstName>?
Yes, Gossam.|***ga_roster_add_object-->String::gossam_ros    String::gossam    ***ga_roster_party_add-->String::gossam_ros    ***ga_reset_level-->String::gossam    Int::1    |
Excellent!  My own task certainly isn't urgent, but if you'd like, we can head to Northdark Wood to look for flora--I'll give you a list of the plants I am looking for.
I am glad to have you join us, halfling. I have a passing interest in certain plants myself.

Indeed, Gossam Thistlefall, it is good to have a cleric among us--and Sheela Peryroyl shares some aspects with my goddess, Sune. |***gc_comp_remove-->NOT::False    String::ianth    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::True    Int::2    |
Thank you, and let us be on our way. And if you don't mind, I'd like to hear your story so far, . I am sure that whatever adventure you are on is at least as grand as mine.
Of course.  I'll speak as we walk.|***ga_journal-->String::Q_GREEN    Int::5    Int::0    Int::0    Int::0    |
Not at the moment.  Perhaps in the future.
Very well.  If you change your mind, you will find me here.
Very well.  Farewell, Gossam.|***ga_journal-->String::Q_GREEN    Int::1    Int::0    Int::0    Int::0    |
I agree with you, Gossam.  Nature can teach us much.
I have to agree with Oudin.  I prefer art to nature.
Well, it is certainly not a matter that will be decided today.
I think that true knowledge comes from being taught by both art and nature.
[Shrug.]
Well met.  I am <FullName>, a <class>.
<FirstName> is my name.  What are you doing here?
You return, I hope, because you want me to travel with you?|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::Q_GREEN    String::1    ***gc_comp_remove-->NOT::True    String::gossam    |
Those who worship Sheela Peryroyl also call her the Green Sister or the Watchful Mother.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::30    |
I respect and admire druids, but feel that there is as much beauty in nature cultivated as there is in nature uncultivated.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False Int::29 |
I hope that my church in Corm Orp is doing well.  I shall have to return there after our adventures.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::28    |
Vroman is a fine gentleman--courteous and urbane--though, I must say, a little on the diffident side.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::27    |
Mistress Ianth is truly nobility; that much is plain.  It is strange to have found such a person is so small a place as Drawn Swords.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::26    |
Those who follow Sheela Peryroyl are called "Green Children."|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::25    |
Sheela Peryroyl is known among the Faerunian deities for her level head; I like to think that I emulate her in this respect.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::24    |
Nature is not chaos; it is full of designs both great and small.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::23    |
I do love this time of year.  Wine, ale, and honey flow; the leaves fall in heaps of red and gold; the air is as crisp and cool as good water.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::22    |
Uncle Asterchord is a knowledgeable old halfling, though I think it would do him good to get out-of-doors once in a while.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::21    |
I spent half of my youth in Gullykin, on the Sword Coast, and half in Corm Orp, in Sunset Vale.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::20    |

My greatest accomplishment as a cleric militant of the Watchful Mother was a shot from my sling that felled an orc who had been pillaging woodlands in Sunset Vale.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::19    |
I have always been a solitary sort of person, but I must admit that I enjoy your company very much, <FirstName>.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::18    |

The seasons are the goddess's way of reminding us that nature is steadfast even as she is mutable.  So, too, should we be at once faithful to ourselves and amenable to circumstance.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::17    |
Though I love the autumn, I'm also partial to winter--and to spring, and to summer!  All the seasons have their beauty.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::16    |
Some day I would like to travel to Luiren, land of the halflings.  But for now I am content to drink the wonderful wheat beer that comes thence.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::15    |
The snow is always deep in Sunset Vale--and for halflings, twice as deep as it is for bigger folk!|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::14    |
To what do we owe our great cities, our small towns, our daily bread?  To the bounty of the Green Sister.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::13    |
My mother and father both dwell in Corm Orp.  Uncle Asterchord is my mother's brother; I have no siblings.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::12    |
The elves of Evereska sometimes have occasion to range as far south as Sunset Vale; I have met a few on the Sunset Trail.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::11    |
I have been through Berdusk and Iriaebor, but do not like big cities very much.  I even find Beregost overwhelming!|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::10    |

It has been a long time since I saw the sea...Once, as a youth...It is full of alien majesty!  But I suppose it would not surprise you to hear that I prefer the green woods and fields.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::9    |
I am always happy to spend a few moments chatting with you, <FirstName>.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::8    |

I always wonder at those who live in despair at what they perceive as the world's great disorder--Do they not see the happy blessings of the Green Sister all around them?|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::7    |

In the spring, the children of Corm Orp flee to the valleys of the woods to hunt for morels; in early summer, they go to the fields to look for strawberries.  Ah, to be a child again!|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::6    |
There is nothing like the drone of bees on a warm day in early summer; even the thought warms me now, as the year draws to a close.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::5    |
I like ale and wine, but do not have a great use for stronger spirits.  I must make an exception for Candlekeep cordial, though.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::4    |
Have you ever taken a look at Uncle Asterchord's books?  He has some marvelous tomes--perhaps even ones that would be helpful to us.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::3    |

One of Uncle Asterchord's most prized possessions is the "Ace of Coins."  If you're curious, you should take a look at it next time we have occasion to shop.|***gc_rand_1of-->NOT::False    Int::2    |
I love identifying, pressing, and documenting strange species of plant.  I feel that the Green Sister smiles on my study; I never take more than a small specimen for my research.
